intro: Drepananthus angustipetalus, commonly known as the narrow-petaled sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its small, tubular flowers that typically range in color from pink to purple. The plant produces small, narrow leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal or semi-arid regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely known outside of its native habitat.
